title: (x) Chanel logo - custom designed {James}
content: Does anyone know what font is used for Chanel?
author: anonymous

comments.content:
![chanel.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47244.gif)   
   
The Chanel logo (above) looks more like a grotesque than a geometric sans to me. It fits somewhere between Akzidenz Grotesk and an extended sans like ITC Blair.

This has come up before [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40697.html?1089977021) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23487.html?1073432004). I believe it's custom designed, but there are good alternatives in those threads. If you want near identical letterforms, Chank's [Katwalk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506/http:/www.chank.com/pdf/katwalk_sampler.pdf) is based (at least in part) on this very design.

p.s.   
   
Does anyone know the model? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

It's the Typophile Supermodel ID Quiz! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/lol.gif)   
   
My guess is [Milla Jovovich](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506/http:/www.millaj.com/).

Justin - No. Not Milla. If you saw her..... you're not going to forget her face, eyes. Anyway- new movie is coming soon....and you can see her....   
   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330221506im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
I don't have an example of Chanel to look at but I think it is Futura
